list_definition.definition: (often with at) to look at with a fixed gaze

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They stared at her clothes in amazement

list_ex_of_english: There are too many people who try to find other solutions when the obvious one is staring them in the face.
The problem of earning our independent livelihood stares us in the face.
Within thirty seconds the baby seal's carcass was cooling on the ice, eyes staring blankly at the sky.
Even when it is staring them in the face, they refuse to accept that what we have done has benefited the health service.
The truth is that it is staring people in the face, and that is the legacy of the past 11 years.
I know that ruin is now absolutely staring them in the face.
Participants were instructed to stare at the letter strings and the square during the rest periods.
The temptation to the former farm worker who has, for instance, sought employment in industry, stares one in the face.
